name: Hotel Ranieri Rome

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed in the hotel 5days.. its location was very good.. u can walk to the hotel from the main train station.. its nearly 20 minutes.. from fontana di trevi to the hotel, it takes 10-12 euros by taxi.. the rooms were good regarding to view and size.. the bathroom was ok also.. neither so big not so small.. we got breakfast also in the hotel.. it was satisfying, not only serving croissant or pancake.. it had also fruits & cereals & milk & tea.. the staff were easily understand english.. its very important in italy ;)
reviews.title: good location, good price, good rooms, good service

reviews.text: I started my travels in Italy, jumping from one location to the next. Honestly in my mind I thought Rome was going to be my least favorite, I thought, 'there's probably going to be a lot of crime and the hotel, ...the picture didn't even do it justice!" (The hotel is safely located with lots of police because of the embassies near by) This hotel was amazing! It looked incredible with old fashioned winding stairs, a nice older gentleman took our bags, and we got in this terrific old elevator, that looked like a cage, the elevator was like a box pulled by a cable. The room was really big, and it felt like I was staying at a room in a really fancy, incredibly big old house. The service at the counter is these 2 amazing girls that are really cheery and the older gentleman also operates the bar in the room furthest back on the first floor, it's a very comfortable lounge. It felt like a place straight out of -I don't know what analogy would be best maybe- "Harry Potter"!!! When you eat in the mornings you go downstairs, in this amazing layout of a floor plan that makes this place by far the most intricate and unique hotel we've ever stayed at. Oh yea, ...and I loved the location, it's only a 3 minute walk to Trevi Fountain and also a bus stop is on the next road over, just turn down Susanna and get on Barberini, and at the end of the road is the bus stop. Rome's been the highlight of our trip thus far, mainly because of this hotel.
reviews.title: Extremely Intricate and Unique Hotel
Nice area and loacen
reviews.text: hotel is not far from trian stastion and nice arwa as loacen . all moest feamas ciry tour spots.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: me and my husband was very satisfied by the service, the hotel facilities and the excellent cleanliness and by the accessibility to the monuments in the center. I recommend it to everyone.
reviews.title: Reasonable family-run hotel

reviews.text: We stayed one night in Rome at this hotel in October and I cannot really say anything wrong about it.
reviews.title: Excellend Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This place was conveniently located within a short walk of the train station. The bed was incredibly comfortable and the room was amazingly clean. The staff was friendly and helpful. Breakfast was delicious. The feel of the hotel was great with its older elevator and marble stair case.
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel!

reviews.text: I stayed in the hotel 4 nights, then in Venice 2 nights and back for one night, the main thing to be mentioned that all staff there are very helpful, Romina and Federica are exceptional... also Jon was very helpful and supportive, they welcomed us with unbelievable hospitality, very cheerful, smiley and proactive.
reviews.title: 5 Star Sevice Hotel

reviews.text: Although the reception is not very wide, but they make you feel very comfortable, they made every thing for us, also the lobby (lounge bar) is very good, free wifi was good in 1st, 2nd and 3rd floor, a little weak signal in 4th floor.... Breakfast is smiple but good, old elevator, but have a smell of old Rome :), nothing is enough to explain support and help of staff in the hotel, all of them.
reviews.title: Hotel Ranieri

reviews.text: When I was leaving to Venice, they offered me to keep luggage in the hotel until I come back if I won't need it, and I did, the left one of my luggage in a private room, they're very honest.
reviews.title: A decent stay, helpful staff

reviews.text: Close to city centre, but you need to walk, bus stop is in front of the hotel, a lot of good restaurant are around.
reviews.title: Creepy... With a few benefits

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked this place because it was close to the Termini Train station. Turns out it was an easy walk to the station but far enough that it was in its own quiet charming neighborhood. Front desk people was friendly and helpful. Room was small and there was no electrical outlet near the bed (which I needed), but it was clean and the TV worked. The Breakfast was good and plentiful. The elevator probably needs an update as it was one of those old style elevators sometimes find in old hotels and it groaned as it went up and down.
reviews.title: Quiet Location in Rome - Who knew

reviews.text: Stayed here for 5 days, perfect location to see the sights in Rome. Termini train station not too far away...great rooms, wireless internet a bit slow but can't complain as it was complimentary...In terms of European hotel rooms this one is quite large...My room overlooked the main road, busy during the day but I never really stayed in the room during the day...some traffic at night ..... Hotel offers airport pickup at a cost of 55 Euros but well worth it. Breakfast was good, coffee available from a machine but also they will prepare fresh espresso and cappuccinos on request, two types of orange juice (normal orange juice and also blood orange) from a machine but still very good, traditional European continental breakfast (fresh fruit and pasteries, cold cuts and cheese) but also american breakfast (scrambled eggs and bacon).
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would stay at this hotel again in any future travels to Rome
reviews.title: Little Gem in Rome
Charming hotel with delightful character
reviews.text: We arrived at the hotel and were greeted straight away by a lovely receptionist and porter who took our things up to the room straight away. We were there for our 10th wedding anniversary so we asked if we could upgrade the room. I would definately recommend choosing a superior room or junior suite if you can afford it as the first room we were shown was very small and tired although it was very clean. If you arent a fan of elevators, ask for a room on a lower floor as the old fashioned elevator, whilst very charming may not be to everyones taste! The hotel is on quite a busy street but it has its own sign and is quite easy to find. Its about a 20 minute walk to the first 'main' sight of Rome, the Trevi Fountain. You can also pick up a tube from the nearest station about 10 minutes walk away. We didnt use the buses. The breakfast was very good and plentiful, with lots of cakes/pastries and a couple of hot choices. The coffee and juice were from machines though and not the best. All in all I think this is a pretty good choice in Rome and a good base for travelling around the city. I would definately return to this hotel. The staff were very knowledgeable and professional.

Great centrally located hotel just around the block from the American Embassy and Termini; easy walk to Trevi Fountain, shopping, and Spanish Steps; a quick bus ride to the Vatican, Colosseum, and across the Tibre. A wide marble, spiral staircase took us up to our very clean, renovated, comfortable rooms, and a smaller spiral staircase lead down to a wonderful dining room where a delicious and plentiful buffet breakfast was served. All of the staff were helpful in providing directions to wherever we wanted to go, however, Romina was absolutely invaluable. Her efforts to ensure we experienced Rome to the fullest were remarkable and very much appreciated.
reviews.title: Great location. Very clean.

reviews.text: The hotel is in a quiet area in easy reach of the city centre by foot in 15 minutes or by bus. Despite being on a road with government offices the street behind the hotel has a number of restaurants within a couple of minutes walk. The Spanish Steps and Trevi Fountain areas are about 10 minutes walk with plenty of restaurants as well.
reviews.title: Clean, comfortable and a good base to see Rome

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The twin room was of sufficient size and comfortable after a hard days exploring in Rome but the bathroom was rather narrow. It was kept very clean and we experienced no problems. There is a handy safe in the room for passports etc.
reviews.title: Lovely

reviews.text: The breakfast was buffet service which was the same each day and adequate, rather than spectacular.
reviews.title: Good Base to explore Rome

reviews.text: Overall a good saty.
reviews.title: Clean and afordable

reviews.text: This quaint hotel is situated across from the Ministry of Finance in a nice area of Rome.
reviews.title: Amazing hotel !!

description: Ranieri is a perfect choice for your stay. For years Ranieri hotel, downtown Rome, has been the ideal spot for those coming to the Eternal City for business or leisure. Ranieri is an independent family owned and managed hotel with excellent location that allows you to reach the historical and archaeological sites of Rome, visit the museums and join the action of the business district or exciting roman street life.
